question.hint: A staff consists of five lines and 4 spaces. All notation is put on the staff or in relation to it.

question.text: Draw a treble clef. Include a staff.
question.hint: This clef is also called the G clef for the way it curves around the G line. Assign the first line of the staff to the E above middle C, the second line to the G, the third line to the B, and fourth line to a D, and the fifth line to an F, which will be more than an octave away from the original E.

question.text: Draw a bass clef. Include a staff.
question.hint: This clef is also called the F clef for the way the two dots hug the F line. Assign the first line of the staff to a G, the second line to B, the third line to D, the fourth line to F, and the fifth line to A (a third below the middle C).

question.text: Draw three ascending quarter notes starting in the middle of the first ledger line above the staff. Use 4/4 time with a treble clef.
question.hint: Due to the limited number of lines and spaces, we have ledger lines. These lines are extensions of the staff for when you do not have enough space.

question.text: Draw three descending quarter notes starting in the middle of the first ledger line below the staff. Use 4/4 time with a bass clef.
question.hint: Due to the limited number of lines and spaces, we have ledger lines. These lines are extensions of the staff for when you do not have enough space.
